intro: Phyllanthus paezensis, commonly known as the Andean spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually simple and opposite. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant is adapted to cold climates and is often found in cloud forests or alpine meadows.
